intro: Echites brachysiphon, commonly known as the narrow-siphon echites, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub with erect, branched stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are yellow and are arranged in compact clusters, attracting various pollinators. Echites brachysiphon is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
